body:
> I creating the config always with this command:
> `rclone config create MyProfile webdav url "$TARGET_URL" vendor owncloud user "$TARGET_USER" pass "$TARGET_PASSWORD"`

You'll need to split this into two so your config password gets obscured in the config file

```
rclone config create MyProfile webdav url "$TARGET_URL" vendor owncloud user "$TARGET_USER"
rclone config password MyProfile pass "$TARGET_PASSWORD"
```

This is working!
A little bit irritating, if iam using the one line config creation, it shows "pass = *** ENCRYPTED ***" as a result and the normal password is working with one line config creation.
Is this behaviour intentional?

Sorry, I forgot that I fixed this in 903ede52cd71a85d80b2db5e98ca677e4aa54ebd so you don't need to use the two line config. This was released for v1.48.0

So I think your original config should have worked....

Can you paste the generated config (XXX out confidential stuff)?

Excuse me please for 19 days no reply.
Tested it with 1.50.1, 1.50.2 and current beta from Dockerhub.
docker run --rm -it --entrypoint /bin/sh rclone/rclone:xxx
Everytime the same behavior normal password is working with MyProfileOneLiner but App-Password not.

Edit:
cat /config/rclone/rclone.conf watched.
You are correct the pass in "MyProfileOneLiner" isnt obscured. But only if I use the App-Password, the normal password is.

Edit2: shrinked post, other informations not needed

Password is not allowed to be longer as 21 characters:
Tested with: `docker run --rm -it --entrypoint /bin/sh rclone/rclone:1.51.0`

21 characters, password is encrypted:
`rclone config create P1 webdav url "https://example.com" vendor owncloud user "jd" pass "123456789012345678901" && grep "pass =" /config/rclone/rclone.conf`
```
Remote config
--------------------
[P1]
type = webdav
user = jd
pass = *** ENCRYPTED ***
url = https://example.com
vendor = owncloud
--------------------
pass = -u1Xf8eD-P96P3-FoyCB3sGlFr1Ttm14FKuO4ArAQnt7GPFFyA
```



22 characters, password is not encrypted:
`rclone config create P1 webdav url "https://example.com" vendor owncloud user "jd" pass "1234567890123456789012" && grep "pass =" /config/rclone/rclone.conf`
```
Remote config
--------------------
[P1]
type = webdav
url = https://example.com
vendor = owncloud
user = jd
pass = *** ENCRYPTED ***
--------------------
pass = 1234567890123456789012
```

Ah... This is because rclone thinks "1234567890123456789012" is already encrypted and it doesn't encrypt it again :-(

You can set it with `rclone config password P1 pass 1234567890123456789012`

I guess rclone needs to stop guessing whether the password is encrypted or not....

Previous uses of `rclone config update ... pass` would have assumed the argument was encrypted.

Maybe I should make some new parameters `plainpass` and `obscuredpass` which don't guess, leaving `pass` as it is for backwards compatibility?

> You can set it with `rclone config password P1 pass 1234567890123456789012`

This is the solution iam using.

> Maybe I should make some new parameters `plainpass` and `obscuredpass` which don't guess, leaving `pass` as it is for backwards compatibility?

In my opinion this would be a clean solution.
An output could be useful which gives a information/warning after using "rclone config create ... pass". Something like "pass has at least 22 characters assumed its already encrypted" "pass assumed unencrypted", or is there actually a documentation I missed?

rename.from: Owncloud app password / app token not usable
rename.to: Fix confusion over whether `pass` is encrypted in `rclone config create`

body:
> An output could be useful which gives a information/warning after using "rclone config create ... pass". Something like "pass has at least 22 characters assumed its already encrypted" "pass assumed unencrypted", or is there actually a documentation I missed?

That is a good idea.

I'll think some more on these unless you fancied sending a pull request?
I want to try it, think I know where to start but I don't know how much time I will need.

Great! No time pressure.

The problem code is here:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/964f1f6a7e4cf150331344c40efc516756683509/fs/config/config.go#L1057-L1066

We need to figure out a way of signalling

1. the password may or may not be obscured (current behaviour)
2. the password **is** obscured
3. the password **is not** obscured

Easy fix might be to prefix the password with `:plaintext:` for 3 and `:obscured:` for 2. This of course potentially clashes with 1 in a minor way...

[I just stumbled over this](https://forum.rclone.org/t/how-can-i-programmatically-add-the-fields-password-and-password2/16233/12). In that case it probably would make sense to update the documentation for now. Because [currently it says](https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_config_create/):

> If any of the parameters passed is a password field, then rclone will automatically obscure them before putting them in the config file.

As well [as here](https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_config_password/):
> This command is obsolete now that “config update” and “config create” both support obscuring passwords directly.

Which is obviously _not_ automatically the case until this issue is solved. :wink: 

~~@ncw is there any corresponding command for setting a salt password / `password2` that is longer than 22 characters long?~~ :thinking:
~~Or should this be:~~ **UPDATE:** Nevermind, this works:

```bash
$ rclone config password MyProfile password "$REGULAR_PASSWORD"
$ rclone config password MyProfile password2 "$SALT_PASSWORD"
```

OK I have fixed this properly here

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.51.0-303-gc0755056-fix-3728-config-obscure-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

This has updated docs and two new flags - let me know if this works for you! It is also available over the rc.

      --no-obscure   Force any passwords not to be obscured.
      --obscure      Force any passwords to be obscured.

> If any of the parameters passed is a password field, then rclone will
> automatically obscure them if they aren't already obscured before
> putting them in the config file.
> 
> **NB** If the password parameter is 22 characters or longer and
> consists only of base64 characters then rclone can get confused about
> whether the password is already obscured or not and put unobscured
> passwords into the config file. If you want to be 100% certain that
> the passwords get obscured then use the "--obscure" flag, or if you
> are 100% certain you are already passing obscured passwords then use
> "--no-obscure".  You can also set osbscured passwords using the
> "rclone config password" command.
>
I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.52

@ncw 

Looks like there is still issue with pass encryption. 

I am using `rclone config create` to create remote - 

```rclone config create 5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp ftp host XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX user user@example.in pass ?faZsBEuNY$x```

and then to transfer file -

```rclone copy --stats-one-line /abc.txt 5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp:/abc -P --no-traverse```

It throws error - "Failed to create file system for "5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp:/abc": NewFs: ftpConnection Login: 530 Login authentication failed"

However, same works fine when rclone remote created interactively.
 
I have even tried by passing option --obscure
```rclone config create 5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp ftp host XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX user user@example.in pass ?faZsBEuNY$x --obscure```

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

There is some issue only with specific passwords (with some special chars).

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.53.2

- os/arch: linux/amd64

- go version: go1.15.3

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Linux TESTNODE1-DEV 4.15.0-1098-azure #109~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Wed Sep 30 18:53:14 UTC 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

FTP / SFTP

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)  
<!--  You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.   -->

```
rclone config create 5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp ftp host XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX user user@example.in pass ?faZsBEuNY$x
```

```
rclone copy --stats-one-line /abc.txt 5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp:/abc -P --no-traverse
```


#### The rclone config contents with secrets removed.  
<!--  You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.   -->

```
[5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp]

type = ftp

user = user@example.in

pass = cC6W-jc9WtV2caO9WPZJ3AZmigQ8bfWyqkc

host = XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX
```



#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag  
<!-- You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.  Or use a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/   -->

```
2020/11/30 08:54:45 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.53.2" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "--stats-one-line" "/abc.txt" "5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp:/abc” "-P" "--no-traverse" "-vv"]

2020/11/30 08:54:45 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/abc.txt"

2020/11/30 08:54:45 DEBUG : Using config file from "/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"

2020/11/30 08:54:45 DEBUG : fs cache: adding new entry for parent of "/abc.txt", "/"

2020/11/30 08:54:45 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp:/abc”

2020/11/30 08:54:45 DEBUG : ftp://XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:21/abc: Connecting to FTP server

2020/11/30 08:54:50 ERROR : ftp://XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:21/abc: Error while Logging in into XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:21: 530 Login authentication failed

2020/11/30 08:54:50 Failed to create file system for "5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp:/a”bc: NewFs: ftpConnection Login: 530 Login authentication failed
```

> I am using `rclone config create` to create remote -
> 
> `rclone config create 5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp ftp host XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX user user@example.in pass ?faZsBEuNY$x`

The shell is interpreting the `$x` - you need quotes round that

    rclone config create 5e7b896190ef80a3ed3d4674-ftp ftp host XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX user user@example.in pass '?faZsBEuNY$x'
